job_title: House Manager in El Cajon, CA
pros: Incredible staff who understand the mission, vision, and values of the company and strive to reach them every day.
cons: I wish I had found Home of Guiding hands sooner!

review_title: Great place to work with great culture!
pros: Home of Guiding Hands is a Great place to work and it feels good to be a part of a team that helps so many people directly in town. Executive staff really is helpful and cares about not only the Agency but the staff as well. They all have an open door policy and always have been helpful & kind when I need help. The Agency offers competitive wages & Benefits.
cons: I am sure some folks have there issues with the Agency but, for me in my job I can think of no real Cons to working here.

review_title: Productive and Meaningful Place to Work
job_title: Development Specialist in El Cajon, CA
pros: Home of Guiding Hands is one of the largest nonprofits serving those with intellectual disabilities in the east county area of San Diego. HGH has many services including residential, life-planning, respite, tailored day, and more. The facility offers a competitive wage, health insurance, pet insurance, and other occupational perks. I recommend HGH to looking for care and resources to their loved ones. I also recommend Home of Guiding Hands for anyone seeking employment with a passion in this field.
cons: Home of Guiding Hands is a large nonprofit which can make getting in contact with a supervisor, a little tricky.

review_title: HGH is a GREAT place to work
pros: If you are looking for a career and not a job, this is a great place to work. Lots of room for advancement.
cons: This business is open 24/7. Most of the employees work nontraditional business hours.

job_title: Transportation Aide in El Cajon, CA
pros: been working 12 years as a transportation aid
cons: working at a facility group home for 1 year

job_title: Residential Service Technician in El Cajon, CA
pros: Great residents,  nice homes, decent work schedule... Most of the management people are nice and easy to talk to... Great nursing staff.
cons: Pay in this field is always poor... The benefits are good though.  There is a 2 week training but a lot of really lazy people are hired,  and make it through.

cons: There are no downsides to working here.
